passages.text: Japan | Japan Insights
On Clients' Minds - Japan

We are pleased to present a selection of research from Japan and across the world that was of the greatest interest to readers over the past week. These include select top- down pieces, stock and sector research.

Japan Quantitative Strategy Japan's 2025 AGM season saw a record 53 shareholder proposals in the Topix 100 universe, up sharply from 11 in 2024 (and 22/6 in 2023/22), signaling a bold new era of investor activism. Proposals focused on governance, board composition, environmental issues, and performance- linked compensation policies. We highlight companies where support for management- backed board and chairman nominations declined, potentially signaling structural change ahead.

Chugai Chugai's ADR climbed \(2\%\) and shares in Lilly rose almost \(6\%\) (S&P500 up \(0.4\%\) ) after Lilly announced new Orforglipron data in obesity patients with diabetes. The headline \(10.5\%\) weight reduction at the highest dose is lower than the \(12.4\%\) observed in a non- diabetic patients (report). We consider this data to be broadly in line with investor expectations, because diabetic patients typically lose less weight than non- diabetic patients.

Japan Tech According to Chinese import statistics announced this week, Jul Chinese SPE imports were \(\) 503.6bn\((+12\%YoY,+12\%MoM)\). Imports for Jan- Jul total\) \ \(28.141bn(+2\%)\) As Jan- Jul imports were stronger than expected, deceleration is expected from Aug onward. Taiwan SPE imports in Jul were \(\) 3.210bn(+42\%)\), showing continued strong growth YOY. Within this, imports from Malaysia (including SoC testers from Advantest) were \(\) 581mn\(down slightly vs. Jun, but still high.

Terumo We slightly raise our current and future estimates to take account of strong 1Q results (report), and the company's planned \(\) 1.5bn\(acquisition of organ technology company, OrganOx. We reiterate our\) \ \(3,300\) PT, and since this represents \(26\%\) potential upside, we reiterate Buy.

Japan IT Services We update our earnings estimates for ILJ, Otsuka, Trend Micro and SCSK, and upgrading ILJ from Hold to Buy, raising our PT from \(\) 3,000\(to\) \ \(3,600\) . ILJ has been trading at a discount to the result of our coverage due to the VMware and cyber security incidents. Market demand for network integration remains steady. We cut our PT for Trend Micro and raise our PTs for Otsuka and SCSK, but maintain our ratings for these three stocks.

Japan SaaS We are upgrading Rakus from Hold to Buy as the company targets to deliver on the 'Rule of 50', which looks realistic. We are also raising our PT for Money Forward from \(\) 6,000\(to\) \ \(8,000\) . Free, we maintain Buy but cut our PT from \(\) 5,000\(to\) \ \(4,100\) . Our top in the sector remaining Money Forward, followed by Rakus and free.

UABJ We update our earnings forecasts for UACJ post Q1 FY3/26 earnings (link). We raise off PT to \(\) 6,300\(, as we expect earnings upside from margins widening between US aluminum prices vs. UBC costs, and ASP hikes should also support profits in Japan. However, given the steep rally in the share price, we think the upside is limited, and hence downgrade the stock to Hold. Potential risks include trade tariffs, cross- shareholding unwinds, and equity issuance.

Nabtesco Mgmt continues evaluating the operating efficiency and growth story of existing business units. Mgmt aims to achieve FY27 sales targets for disclosed major segments, and its comment led us to believe the scale of any near- term reorganization action may be smaller than the announced divestiture of hydraulic equipment business. Our new price target implies Nabtesco's profit growth over FY25- 26 has been reflected in consensus estimates.
US Insights: What You Need to Know
Europe Insights: In Case You Missed It...
On Clients' Minds - Asia

Japan Business & Employment Services We update our models for Persol and En Japan and retain Hold rating. This sector has been active in M&A, with the latest instance being Technopro (6028 JP), which is in talks for a takeover by Blackstone. As for En Japan, Hong Kong- based activist fund Oasis has declared \(6\%\) stake in April 2025. Therefore, other companies may follow a similar pattern, in our view. As for the Q1 and outlook, Persol has room to increase earnings in Q3, after a likely lukewarm Q2.

Ulvac Ulvac announced FY6/25 results on Aug13. It reported \(\yen 26.5bn\) in FY6/25 OP (- 11% YoY), roughly in line with guidance updated at 3Q timing. Ulvac officially announced the Value Up Plan, a new longer- term business plan that covers five years. It presented detailed content of the plan to implement business reforms over the next two years and accelerate growth through FY6/31. We revise our estimates. Revise PT to \(\yen 8,000\) . Maintain Buy rating.

Aurelia Metals uEBITDA was broadly in line with our and VAE when accounting for \(\) 7.85\(mn non- recurring biodiversity credits sales. Lower D&A was partially offset by higher interest expense. Planned FY26 debt refi will unlock liquidity, while Fed's shift to commercial production will normalise the P&L and commence depreciating. Ramp - up at Fed, and growth at Peak & Great Cobar is clouded by lingering Resource uncertainty at Fed. Reiterate BUY, PT AUD0.28.

Franchise Report: India Pharmaceuticals India's CRDMO industry is at an inflection point, evolving from quasi- chemical firms to strategic partners for innovators, backed by capabilities and geographic diversification. We believe China+1 is a structural story that can drive high- teen revenue CAGR for the next decade. Our pipeline analysis reveals a healthy molecules buildup for Sai, Piramal, Divi's and Cohanee. We initiate coverage on Cohanee with Buy, upgrade Divi's to Buy, and our top pick is Sai.

China Tech US President Trump's offer to lift the ban on H20 to entice China to relax rare earth export controls has backfired, as China has already banned H20 purchases "until further notice." The "chip for rare earth" strategy failed. But China is likely more interested in "rare earths for WFE," as its LT plan is to make its own AI chips to avoid getting "addicted" to US tech. China's chip imports still exceed its oil imports. Western WFE stocks could benefit.

USA Thematic Research Jefferies hosted over 100 companies at the 2025 Consumer Conference this past week. Many of the individual discussions were recapped in greater detail in separate notes. High- level takeaways include: 1) stable but continued pressure on the low- end consumer; 2) a focus on execution & self- help mindset an uncertain macro and 3) mgmt. teams incorporating plenty of tariff policy cushion outloots.

USA Software Software adoption is accelerating in the enterprise but remains early, with monetization still in the low to mid- single digit range of overall revenue. We expect a broader ramp into 2026, with MSFT (top enterprise pick), META (top consumer pick), & SNOW (data & AI breakout play) among the best- positioned to capitalize on this shift, offering attractive risk/reward as AI moves from hype to tangible rev impact. See \(175+\) pg deep dive inside.

Uranks Pre- GFC, over \(6\%\) of housing changed hands each year. Today, that is \(4\%\) . Stamp duty, where marginal rates can reach \(15\%\) , likely plays a role, impeding mobility and the efficient use of stock. Reduced churn also traps housing equity, now the largest pool of UK household wealth. Given the fiscal challenges, reform of housing taxes may be a risk too far. But as a demand and supply side policy, there may be few with as much potential.

Europe Chemicals The majority of the European chemicals coverage require an above average 2H earnings contribution to reach guidance/consensus forecasts. We are on average \(- 2\%\) below consensus (- 4% across diversifies, and - 1% in consumer chemicals), whilst consumer ingredients

James Heaney has a long position in Facebook.

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
